Mission 12

Area of Triangles

Mission 12: Area of Triangles

[SYSTEM NOTIFICATION] A C-Rank Gate has been detected. Difficulty: Geometry. Hunter, prepare to master the Triangle Theorem!

The Challenge Awaits

Young Hunter, understanding area is essential for planning dungeon raids. How much space does a trap zone cover? What's the size of a safe area? Triangular formations appear everywhere in tactical combat.

Today, you discover why a triangle's area is exactly HALF of a rectangle's area. This knowledge will serve you well in advanced dungeons.

âš”ï¸ Hunter's Arsenal (Gear Checklist)

Gather these exact items before entering the Gate: - Post-it notes or paper & tape - Play-dough or clay - Graph paper - Rulers or tape measures (for older students)

ğŸ¯ Mission Objectives

Upon completion of this Gate, you will have unlocked: - Area Calculation - Find area of triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons (6.G.1) - Shape Composition - Decompose complex shapes into rectangles and triangles (6.G.1) - Real-World Application - Solve practical area problems (6.G.1)

ğŸ“– The Hunter's Knowledge (Brain Download)

The Triangle Area Formula

Area of Triangle = Â½ Ã— Base Ã— Height

A = Â½ Ã— b Ã— h

Why Â½?

A triangle is exactly HALF of a rectangle:

Rectangle:          Cut diagonally:      Two triangles:

Finding Base and Height

The HEIGHT must be PERPENDICULAR (90Â°) to the BASE:

Video Lesson: Area of a Triangle (watch first 5 minutes)

ğŸ—¡ï¸ The Quest (Activity)

ğŸ“œ Verbatim Instructions:

Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing and decomposing into rectangles, triangles and/or other shapes.

Using graph paper draw triangles and practice finding the area of a triangle. A= Â½ base X height. Here is a link to explore how to find the base and height of a triangle: Illustrative math.

Find the area of a rectangle (this can be done by finding rectangles around the house or drawing them on graph paper) then divide it in half to find the area of a triangle that would fit in the rectangle. If drawing this on a graph paper, draw the triangle inside of the rectangle.

Extension: Quilt Triangles - This might be a fun extension activity to explore the area of triangles.

ğŸ’¡ Hunter's Strategy Guide

Phase 1: Draw a Rectangle

Phase 3: Verify with Formula

Triangle:
Base = 6
Height = 4

A = Â½ Ã— 6 Ã— 4
A = Â½ Ã— 24
A = 12 square units âœ“

Phase 4: Practice Problems

Triangle 1: Base = 8, Height = 5
A = Â½ Ã— 8 Ã— 5 = 20 square units

Triangle 2: Base = 10, Height = 3
A = Â½ Ã— 10 Ã— 3 = 15 square units

Triangle 3: Base = 7, Height = 7
A = Â½ Ã— 7 Ã— 7 = 24.5 square units

Claude Code Training

[TRAINING PROTOCOL ACTIVATED]
Before attempting the assignment, you must train with your AI companion. Claude will guide you through the concepts and verify your understanding.

Step 1: Open Your Terminal

Open a terminal on your computer and run this command to start Claude Code:

claude --dangerously-skip-permissions

Step 2: Summon Your Guide

Copy and paste this prompt to begin your training:

Hey Claude, I'm Hunter Hyro on Mission 12 about finding triangle area.
I need to master A = 1/2 Ã— base Ã— height before my geometry assignment.

Be my training guide and:
1. Explain WHERE the 1/2 comes from (why half?)
2. Show me how to identify the base and height (perpendicular!)
3. Give me 3 triangle area problems to solve
4. Quiz me by having me work backwards (given area, find missing dimension)
5. Have me explain WHY triangle area is half of rectangle area

Only tell me "Quest Unlocked" when I truly understand. Don't let me skip ahead!
Start by drawing a rectangle and showing how a triangle fits inside.

Step 3: Complete Your Training

Work through all phases with Claude:

  • Phase 1: Learn the concept (Claude explains)
  • Phase 2: Answer checkpoint questions
  • Phase 3: Complete 3 skill trials
  • Phase 4: Pass the Boss Challenge
  • Phase 5: Teach the concept back to Claude

You cannot proceed until Claude says "Quest Unlocked"!

ğŸ“¤ Proof of Completion

Submit your evidence: - Video of you doing the activity, OR - Picture/scan of your written work

The System awaits your proof, Hunter.

Hunter's Wisdom: Whenever you see a triangle, imagine the rectangle that surrounds it. The triangle is always exactly half! This works for ALL triangles, not just right triangles.
